message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.PF, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses the dynamics of file sharing in BitTorrent, which involves networked systems and distributed computing, making it likely to fall under the Networked and Distributed Systems (cs.NI) category. The paper also discusses the control of rare segments, which could be related to Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) and Performance (cs.PF) categories. The use of an epidemic model to study the dissemination of segments could also fall under the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) category. Finally, the paper discusses the trade-offs between performance improvement, load on permanent seeders, and content availability, which could be related to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) category.
